MONL.content: “sovereign establishment (mise en demeure souveraine) [sovereign summons]… disguised under alibis of ‘universal’ humanism”
MONL.linkedContent: “sovereign establishment (mise en demeure souveraine) [sovereign summons]… disguised under alibis of ‘universal’ humanism”

PP.content: king, father, does not need to write, testifies to his sovereign independence
PP.linkedContent: king, father, does not need to write, testifies to his sovereign independence

PAS.content: diabolism, double of sovereignty, its trap must take on all forms of sovereignty: méconnaissance and forgetting w/out remains; sovereign traps the devil, lui donnant ainsi raison, risks leaving him the last word
PAS.linkedContent: diabolism, double of sovereignty, its trap must take on all forms of sovereignty: méconnaissance and forgetting w/out remains; sovereign traps the devil, lui donnant ainsi raison, risks leaving him the last word

R.content: ipseity, autotely, self-relation, sovereign self-determination (gives itself its own law), self-representation, reappropriating and gathering of self in the simultaneity of an assemblage or assembly, being together, or “living together”
R.linkedContent: ipseity, autotely, self-relation, sovereign self-determination (gives itself its own law), self-representation, reappropriating and gathering of self in the simultaneity of an assemblage or assembly, being together, or “living together”

R.content: de Tocqueville sees America as having a sovereignty that acts circularly by itself with no operator or sovereign divided-off from it, or outside of it > “no authorities except w/in itself” [Rousseau’s Social Contract] [p. 15 pure actuality of Aristotle’s Prime Mover]
R.linkedContent: de Tocqueville sees America as having a sovereignty that acts circularly by itself with no operator or sovereign divided-off from it, or outside of it > “no authorities except w/in itself” [Rousseau’s Social Contract] [p. 15 pure actuality of Aristotle’s Prime Mover]

R.content: democratic sovereignty replaces theogonic politics with something just as phallocentric, phallo-paterno-filio-fraterno-ipsocentric (ipsocratic, though tautological, because ipseity already implies force)
R.linkedContent: democratic sovereignty replaces theogonic politics with something just as phallocentric, phallo-paterno-filio-fraterno-ipsocentric (ipsocratic, though tautological, because ipseity already implies force)

R.content: by killing father Cronos (infinite order of time), Zeus wills out over time, touches the finitude of time, sovereignty as the instant of a decision, end to time and language
R.linkedContent: by killing father Cronos (infinite order of time), Zeus wills out over time, touches the finitude of time, sovereignty as the instant of a decision, end to time and language

R.content: [Nietzsche-like?] [Derrida by way of Aristotle by way of Plato] the “just more than one,” a god among men, not a part of a whole or calculable series; law, calculability, would betray justice for those who are the law > fable of sovereignty returns
R.linkedContent: [Nietzsche-like?] [Derrida by way of Aristotle by way of Plato] the “just more than one,” a god among men, not a part of a whole or calculable series; law, calculability, would betray justice for those who are the law > fable of sovereignty returns

R.content: to-come: democracy does not exist, never present, not because deferred but because aporetic in its structure  (force without force, incalculable singularity and calculable equality, commensurability and incommensurability, heteronomy and autonomy, indivisible sovereignty and divisible or shared sovereignty, a despairing messianicity)
R.linkedContent: to-come: democracy does not exist, never present, not because deferred but because aporetic in its structure (force without force, incalculable singularity and calculable equality, commensurability and incommensurability, heteronomy and autonomy, indivisible sovereignty and divisible or shared sovereignty, a despairing messianicity)

R.content: sovereignty: silent and unavowable, betrays democracy, the stigmatic point of an indivisible instant
R.linkedContent: sovereignty: silent and unavowable, betrays democracy, the stigmatic point of an indivisible instant

R.content: Schmitt is right, a pure sovereignty (decisionist exceptionality) is indivisible or not at all > incompatible w/ universality & internationality that always calls for it
R.linkedContent: Schmitt is right, a pure sovereignty (decisionist exceptionality) is indivisible or not at all > incompatible w/ universality & internationality that always calls for it

R.content: pure sovereignty: ahistorical, event w/out historical temporal thickness [surface literature, see GT]
R.linkedContent: pure sovereignty: ahistorical, event w/out historical temporal thickness [surface literature, see GT]

R.content: to define pure sovereignty is to compromise its immunity, it doesn’t exist
R.linkedContent: to define pure sovereignty is to compromise its immunity, it doesn’t exist

R.content: abuse of power [law of use] is constitutive of sovereignty itself
R.linkedContent: abuse of power [law of use] is constitutive of sovereignty itself

R.content: only a God w/out sovereignty can save us? nothing is less sure, that is why we are talking, and what we are talking about [also re: democracy]
R.linkedContent: only a God w/out sovereignty can save us? nothing is less sure, that is why we are talking, and what we are talking about [also re: democracy]

SPOM.content: both mask and helmet share the (supreme sign of) power: looking w/out being seen
SPOM.linkedContent: both mask and helmet share the (supreme sign of) power: looking w/out being seen

FWT.content: arguments for human sovereignty, and the idealism that goes along w/ it > always contains an insult, a contempt for animals
FWT.linkedContent: arguments for human sovereignty, and the idealism that goes along w/ it > always contains an insult, a contempt for animals

FWT.content: indispensable dissociation btwn unconditionality (justice w/out power) & sovereignty (right, power, or potency)—that’s deconstruction: on the side of unconditionality, even when it seems impossible > but, sometimes (anti-)sovereigntist, examine each situation
FWT.linkedContent: indispensable dissociation btwn unconditionality (justice w/out power) & sovereignty (right, power, or potency)—that’s deconstruction: on the side of unconditionality, even when it seems impossible > but, sometimes (anti-)sovereigntist, examine each situation

FWT.content: given that DP revolves around equivalence of an eye for an eye, question of DP is not only about political onto-theology of sovereignty, but principle of reason as calculability
FWT.linkedContent: given that DP revolves around equivalence of an eye for an eye, question of DP is not only about political onto-theology of sovereignty, but principle of reason as calculability

FWT.content: Derrida follows Freud’s breaches & openings, a reaffirmation of reason “w/out alibi,” goes against a certain historical concept of reason, can even provoke thought beyond “power,” “drive for power,” drive for sovereignty
FWT.linkedContent: Derrida follows Freud’s breaches & openings, a reaffirmation of reason “w/out alibi,” goes against a certain historical concept of reason, can even provoke thought beyond “power,” “drive for power,” drive for sovereignty

DPi.content: DP: arrêtée par un arrêt de justice > an end decreed by the Other, a verdict > this is not the archetype of every decision [?], though it reminds us: sovereign decision always the Other’s
DPi.linkedContent: DP: arrêtée par un arrêt de justice > an end decreed by the Other, a verdict > this is not the archetype of every decision [?], though it reminds us: sovereign decision always the Other’s

DPi.content: no invisibility of DP: polis must see condemned one die > as a way for sovereign to best see itself > its sovereignty: il se voit
DPi.linkedContent: no invisibility of DP: polis must see condemned one die > as a way for sovereign to best see itself > its sovereignty: il se voit

DPi.content: stage lighting of DP, light of fire, never is sovereign more visible than when it makes itself voyante et voyeuse of execution > sovereign witnesses crime, witnesses itself, eye witness
DPi.linkedContent: stage lighting of DP, light of fire, never is sovereign more visible than when it makes itself voyante et voyeuse of execution > sovereign witnesses crime, witnesses itself, eye witness

DPi.content: Rousseau: DP affirmed after chapter on sovereignty [this sequence is reversed in Derrida]
DPi.linkedContent: Rousseau: DP affirmed after chapter on sovereignty [this sequence is reversed in Derrida]

DPi.content: to think DP, must think history/horizon of sovereignty as hyphen in theologico-political
DPi.linkedContent: to think DP, must think history/horizon of sovereignty as hyphen in theologico-political

DPi.content: in theological-political structure of DP in 4 examples above: the sanhedrin, the Greek priests, the church must be only guardian/guarantor of word of God > DP against another political theology: in the name of transcendence against transcendence [p. 28 sovereignty against sovereignty]
DPi.linkedContent: in theological-political structure of DP in 4 examples above: the sanhedrin, the Greek priests, the church must be only guardian/guarantor of word of God > DP against another political theology: in the name of transcendence against transcendence [p. 28 sovereignty against sovereignty]

DPi.content: always telephone today linking, like an umbilical cord of life or death, place of execution to executive power of sovereign
DPi.linkedContent: always telephone today linking, like an umbilical cord of life or death, place of execution to executive power of sovereign

DPi.content: DP as Christian theater of sovereignty, mercy, right of pardon
DPi.linkedContent: DP as Christian theater of sovereignty, mercy, right of pardon

DPi.content: telephone: technics of transcendence, technics of teleferic relation to sovereignty of absent other, absent God
DPi.linkedContent: telephone: technics of transcendence, technics of teleferic relation to sovereignty of absent other, absent God

DPi.content: vis-à-vis Nietzsche, sovereignty of music: Sprache des Willens—telephone exchanged w/ God: priest as musician
DPi.linkedContent: vis-à-vis Nietzsche, sovereignty of music: Sprache des Willens—telephone exchanged w/ God: priest as musician

DPi.content: if ascesis rejects body, telephonic language rises above, bringing the distant close to itself, the mediate immediate > the priest, mouthpiece for the in-itself of things speaks in language of metaphysics (er redete Metaphysik)
DPi.linkedContent: if ascesis rejects body, telephonic language rises above, bringing the distant close to itself, the mediate immediate > the priest, mouthpiece for the in-itself of things speaks in language of metaphysics (er redete Metaphysik)

DPi.content: still there is enjoyment on the “metaphysical line,” aesthetic renunciation renounces nothing
DPi.linkedContent: still there is enjoyment on the “metaphysical line,” aesthetic renunciation renounces nothing

DPi.content: telephony is metaphysics: religious, sacrificial, asceticism itself, priesthood itself
DPi.linkedContent: telephony is metaphysics: religious, sacrificial, asceticism itself, priesthood itself

DPi.content: DP: divine weapon granted by sovereign God to sovereign monarch to fulfill providential law
DPi.linkedContent: DP: divine weapon granted by sovereign God to sovereign monarch to fulfill providential law

PF.content: to think divisibility of trait of sovereignty deconstructs a certain fable, certain “as if,” of the political onto-theology of sovereignty: 1. sovereignty can resist international capital 2. deconstruct sovereignty while acknowledging all rights of subject founded on concept 3. sovereignty seems exceptional, indivisible, but ‘trait of sovereignty’ divides like any frontier > frontier limit se partageant: divides by sharing itself, shares itself by dividing
PF.linkedContent: to think divisibility of trait of sovereignty deconstructs a certain fable, certain “as if,” of the political onto-theology of sovereignty: 1. sovereignty can resist international capital 2. deconstruct sovereignty while acknowledging all rights of subject founded on concept 3. sovereignty seems exceptional, indivisible, but ‘trait of sovereignty’ divides like any frontier > frontier limit se partageant: divides by sharing itself, shares itself by dividing

PF.content: how to think durable hardness, invincibility, of an onto-theologico-political phantasm: i.e. sovereignty?
PF.linkedContent: how to think durable hardness, invincibility, of an onto-theologico-political phantasm: i.e. sovereignty?

PSSS.content: cruelty & sovereignty (very obscure things) pose a resistance to psychoanalysis, just as psychoanalysis resists them > this border (inside/outside) of psychoanalysis bears weight of our questions: historical, ethical, juridical, political
PSSS.linkedContent: cruelty & sovereignty (very obscure things) pose a resistance to psychoanalysis, just as psychoanalysis resists them > this border (inside/outside) of psychoanalysis bears weight of our questions: historical, ethical, juridical, political

PSSS.content: all which resists psychoanalysis in the mondialisation of today, e.g. psycho-pharmacological medicine, positivist science, but mainly an archaic onto-theological metaphysics of sovereignty, individual or state (freedom, consciousness, intention, ego, will), barely scratched or thought or deconstructed by psychoanalysis—is this psychoanalysis’ own autoimmunity? its resistance?
PSSS.linkedContent: all which resists psychoanalysis in the mondialisation of today, e.g. psycho-pharmacological medicine, positivist science, but mainly an archaic onto-theological metaphysics of sovereignty, individual or state (freedom, consciousness, intention, ego, will), barely scratched or thought or deconstructed by psychoanalysis—is this psychoanalysis’ own autoimmunity? its resistance?

PSSS.content: psychoanalysis has failed to think, change axioms, of ethical, political, juridical sovereignty, where most cruel/traumatic events take place today; also, psych. has failed to think unprecedented juridical performatives: Human Rights, Death Penalty, international penal system, laws against cruel & unusual punishment…
PSSS.linkedContent: psychoanalysis has failed to think, change axioms, of ethical, political, juridical sovereignty, where most cruel/traumatic events take place today; also, psych. has failed to think unprecedented juridical performatives: Human Rights, Death Penalty, international penal system, laws against cruel & unusual punishment…

PSSS.content: psychoanalysis will be left behind if it doesn’t analyze mutation of subject of the subject, citizen subject
PSSS.linkedContent: psychoanalysis will be left behind if it doesn’t analyze mutation of subject of the subject, citizen subject

PSSS.content: imperative will always be the question of principle, the principle, of sovereign prince, princedom
PSSS.linkedContent: imperative will always be the question of principle, the principle, of sovereign prince, princedom

PSSS.content: mastery, sovereignty (Herrschaft, Bemächtigung), linked to a drive for power, possession, an “I can,” a performative power (Bemächtigungstrieb), via sworn faith (organizes Lacan’s symbolic), indissociable from Bewältigung (exercise of power, movement of appropriation)
PSSS.linkedContent: mastery, sovereignty (Herrschaft, Bemächtigung), linked to a drive for power, possession, an “I can,” a performative power (Bemächtigungstrieb), via sworn faith (organizes Lacan’s symbolic), indissociable from Bewältigung (exercise of power, movement of appropriation)

PSSS.content: condemning/saving inscribe in concepts sovereignty & cruelty an ambiguity as unrelievable as autoimmunity itself: in any paregicide, any Oedipus, any totem + taboo, any republican or democratic installation of brothers, no way to know whether paregicide took place or not, took place w/out taking place, before any question about it [see HYMEN]
PSSS.linkedContent: condemning/saving inscribe in concepts sovereignty & cruelty an ambiguity as unrelievable as autoimmunity itself: in any paregicide, any Oedipus, any totem + taboo, any republican or democratic installation of brothers, no way to know whether paregicide took place or not, took place w/out taking place, before any question about it [see HYMEN]

TN.linkedContent: touching-power (pouvoir le toucher): 1) force of power, free, sovereign, potency 2) reserved virtuality, dunamis, capability

TN.content: touching has potential or power to touch personal pronoun “who” and definite article “what”

AD.content: via Benveniste, hosti-pet-s: links hospitality & ipseity, like 2 sovereign powers > “guest-master”
AD.linkedContent: via Benveniste, hosti-pet-s: links hospitality & ipseity, like 2 sovereign powers > “guest-master”

CF.content: is forgiveness a faculty? a sovereign “I can,” a human power?
CF.linkedContent: is forgiveness a faculty? a sovereign “I can,” a human power?

CF.content: sovereignty of human metaphysically aligned w/ sovereignty of Nation, though often appeal to human rights aspires to limit powers of Nation-States
CF.linkedContent: sovereignty of human metaphysically aligned w/ sovereignty of Nation, though often appeal to human rights aspires to limit powers of Nation-States

CF.content: States remain jealous of their own sovereignty in limiting that of others [re: Gulf war]; for Arendt, sovereignty only imposed where it’s ‘possible,’ imposed on the weak by the strong
CF.linkedContent: States remain jealous of their own sovereignty in limiting that of others [re: Gulf war]; for Arendt, sovereignty only imposed where it’s ‘possible,’ imposed on the weak by the strong

CF.linkedContent: Jankélévitch/Arendt: one only forgives where one can judge/punish > supposes power, force, sovereignty

CF.content: Derrida’s mad, not so mad, dream of forgiveness w/out power: unconditional but w/out sovereignty
CF.linkedContent: Derrida’s mad, not so mad, dream of forgiveness w/out power: unconditional but w/out sovereignty

BSi.content: minimal sovereignty: power to give, suspend, make law
BSi.linkedContent: minimal sovereignty: power to give, suspend, make law

BSi.content: Hobbes’ sovereignty breaks w/ Aristotle’s political animal [?]
BSi.linkedContent: Hobbes’ sovereignty breaks w/ Aristotle’s political animal [?]

BSi.content: Hobbes: “Soveraignty is an Artificiall Soul” > soul as principle of life, vitality, vivacity
BSi.linkedContent: Hobbes: “Soveraignty is an Artificiall Soul” > soul as principle of life, vitality, vivacity

BSi.content: state, a robot, an animal monster, giant prosthesis designed to amplify
BSi.linkedContent: state, a robot, an animal monster, giant prosthesis designed to amplify

BSi.content: animal-machine, living-machine, machine of death: serving the living > prosthstate, and yet vitalist in that it mimics the body > civil war [like Schmitt?] death of the State
BSi.linkedContent: animal-machine, living-machine, machine of death: serving the living > prosthstate, and yet vitalist in that it mimics the body > civil war [like Schmitt?] death of the State

BSi.content: for Hobbes, sovereignty causes fear & fear makes the sovereign
BSi.linkedContent: for Hobbes, sovereignty causes fear & fear makes the sovereign

BSi.content: for Hobbes, only crime where there’s sovereign power
BSi.linkedContent: for Hobbes, only crime where there’s sovereign power

BSi.content: majestas, majestatem, akran exousian, kurian arkh[ē], kurion politeuma, segnioria, tismar shabat [see Bennington's footnote for #s of errors in Derrida’s transliterations]
BSi.linkedContent: majestas, majestatem, akran exousian, kurian arkh[ē], kurion politeuma, segnioria, tismar shabat [see Bennington's footnote for #s of errors in Derrida’s transliterations]

BSi.content: [vis-à-vis Balibar] Bodin, Hobbes—political sovereignty as mimesis of God (the sovereign sovereign): ontotheology of phrase “marks of sovereignty”
BSi.linkedContent: [vis-à-vis Balibar] Bodin, Hobbes—political sovereignty as mimesis of God (the sovereign sovereign): ontotheology of phrase “marks of sovereignty”

BSi.content: Hobbes’ rage against the liars who appeal (to God) above the sovereign: 1) the lie of immediacy 2) partisans, civil disobedients: place a law above law 3) like the Jews, don’t accept sovereign as lieu-tenant of God > p. 53 [but!] acc. Hobbes, the sovereign mimics God, Christian incarnation; p. 54 lieutenant as suppléant for other along metonymic chain
BSi.linkedContent: Hobbes’ rage against the liars who appeal (to God) above the sovereign: 1) the lie of immediacy 2) partisans, civil disobedients: place a law above law 3) like the Jews, don’t accept sovereign as lieu-tenant of God > p. 53 [but!] acc. BSi.content: sovereign as God does not (need to) respond [Levinas’ death] > sovereignty expropriates ecstasy of irresponsibility: bestiality, divinity, death (each dogmatically designated as unresponsive)
BSi.linkedContent: sovereign as God does not (need to) respond [Levinas’ death] > sovereignty expropriates ecstasy of irresponsibility: bestiality, divinity, death (each dogmatically designated as unresponsive)

BSi.content: international rights & crimes against humanity invoke a sovereignty of man himself (ipse, ipsissimus) above/beyond/before Nation-State sovereignty (Schmitt sees this as Entpolitisierung, humanity not a political concept)
BSi.linkedContent: international rights & crimes against humanity invoke a sovereignty of man himself (ipse, ipsissimus) above/beyond/before Nation-State sovereignty (Schmitt sees this as Entpolitisierung, humanity not a political concept)

BSi.content: repoliticization (another politicization not depoliticization), a slow and differentiated deconstruction occurs in the divisibility of sovereignty already happening
BSi.linkedContent: repoliticization (another politicization not depoliticization), a slow and differentiated deconstruction occurs in the divisibility of sovereignty already happening

BSi.content: what is proper to man throws certain [Nation-State] sovereignty into crisis
BSi.linkedContent: what is proper to man throws certain [Nation-State] sovereignty into crisis

BSi.content: sovereign, the arkhē, capital, chief, king, who can lose his head, go mad
BSi.linkedContent: sovereign, the arkhē, capital, chief, king, who can lose his head, go mad

BSi.content: sovereign, highest, most eminent capital or capitalization, monopolizes force/violence—Gewalt—gives reason in advance to force through right
BSi.linkedContent: sovereign, highest, most eminent capital or capitalization, monopolizes force/violence—Gewalt—gives reason in advance to force through right

BSi.content: [vis-à-vis Fontaine] that the sovereign’s [wolf’s] power (rage) is always an act of revenge, thus the beast [lamb] has originary guilt (ursprüngliche Schuldigsein): “si ce n’est toi, c’est donc ton frère”

BSi.content: erected marionettes, Sovereign in its Majesty, Most High—not merely a trope, [it’s sublimity is even practical]: surveillance (economic/military) strategy
BSi.linkedContent: erected marionettes, Sovereign in its Majesty, Most High—not merely a trope, [it’s sublimity is even practical]: surveillance (economic/military) strategy

BSi.content: “excellently eminent and excellently phallic erection of sovereign highness”
BSi.linkedContent: “excellently eminent and excellently phallic erection of sovereign highness”

BSi.content: phallus as marionette avant la lettre: simulacrum, prosthetic, automatic machine—is the phallus human at all? > phallic erection is a machine but also the attribute of sovereignty
BSi.linkedContent: phallus as marionette avant la lettre: simulacrum, prosthetic, automatic machine—is the phallus human at all? > phallic erection is a machine but also the attribute of sovereignty

BSi.content: reconstitute sovereignty by 1) transferring it to the other, i.e. no longer my sovereignty 2) or should the idea itself be contested?
BSi.linkedContent: reconstitute sovereignty by 1) transferring it to the other, i.e. no longer my sovereignty 2) or should the idea itself be contested?

BSi.content: if phallus is proper to sovereign, is it proper to man?
BSi.linkedContent: if phallus is proper to sovereign, is it proper to man?

BSi.content: Nietzsche’s superman, and the sovereign too, a hyperbolic, sublime, “higher than height,” more about excess than height, it’s the more than that counts, the surplus, absolutely more: could as well be a maximum of smallness, God as small (sovereign use of nanotechnology)
BSi.linkedContent: Nietzsche’s superman, and the sovereign too, a hyperbolic, sublime, “higher than height,” more about excess than height, it’s the more than that counts, the surplus, absolutely more: could as well be a maximum of smallness, God as small (sovereign use of nanotechnology)

BSi.content: French Revolution inaugurates new form (sovereignty of people, international model) of same fundamental structure of sovereignty (knowing-power, knowing-how-to-see): walls destroyed, but architectural model not deconstructed
BSi.linkedContent: French Revolution inaugurates new form (sovereignty of people, international model) of same fundamental structure of sovereignty (knowing-power, knowing-how-to-see): walls destroyed, but architectural model not deconstructed

BSi.content: zoos profitable to knowledge and economy [physiocratic theory of economy]
BSi.linkedContent: zoos profitable to knowledge and economy [physiocratic theory of economy]

BSi.content: nomos of oikos: taming, training, the domus of the dominus > oikonomia also general condition of ipseity as sovereign mastery over beast
BSi.linkedContent: nomos of oikos: taming, training, the domus of the dominus > oikonomia also general condition of ipseity as sovereign mastery over beast

BSi.content: narrative/representation structural to sovereignty, its force, its dynamis and its energeia (virtual & actual power) > sovereignty draws all its power from simulacrum-, fiction-, representation-effect > mystification of representation constituted by the simulacrum of a true transfer of sovereignty
BSi.linkedContent: narrative/representation structural to sovereignty, its force, its dynamis and its energeia (virtual & actual power) > sovereignty draws all its power from simulacrum-, fiction-, representation-effect > mystification of representation constituted by the simulacrum of a true transfer of sovereignty

BSi.content: Bemächtigungstrieb: beyond other drives, beyond death drive, think sovereignty through drive, transference, inheritance, transmission, sovereignty itself is nothing, is excess, beyond everything
BSi.linkedContent: Bemächtigungstrieb: beyond other drives, beyond death drive, think sovereignty through drive, transference, inheritance, transmission, sovereignty itself is nothing, is excess, beyond everything

BSi.content: liberty & sovereignty (its limitless “I can”) are indissociable, double bind in 2 senses: 1) double injunction 2) duplicity in very concept of binding, obligation, bind, bond: stricture rather than structure, stricture that limits liberty along w/ sovereignty or sovereignty along w/ liberty
BSi.linkedContent: liberty & sovereignty (its limitless “I can”) are indissociable, double bind in 2 senses: 1) double injunction 2) duplicity in very concept of binding, obligation, bind, bond: stricture rather than structure, stricture that limits liberty along w/ sovereignty or sovereignty along w/ liberty

BSi.content: double bind [#1 above]: deconstruct ontotheology of sovereignty w/out questioning liberty in name of which we put this deconstruction to work: think liberty differently, w/in distribution of a divisible sovereignty > think unconditional w/out indivisible sovereignty
BSi.linkedContent: double bind [#1 above]: deconstruct ontotheology of sovereignty w/out questioning liberty in name of which we put this deconstruction to work: think liberty differently, w/in distribution of a divisible sovereignty > think unconditional w/out indivisible sovereignty

BSi.content: supervised liberty is most common condition, and therefore supervised sovereignty > who would dare say we want to escape it?
BSi.linkedContent: supervised liberty is most common condition, and therefore supervised sovereignty > who would dare say we want to escape it?

BSi.content: threshold as solid, indivisible, threshold as arkhē: commencement and commandment > archon, figure of sovereign himself
BSi.linkedContent: threshold as solid, indivisible, threshold as arkhē: commencement and commandment > archon, figure of sovereign himself

BSi.content: for Aristotle, autarkeia (self-sufficiency), sovereign, has an end in himself, is best > the end of everything
BSi.linkedContent: for Aristotle, autarkeia (self-sufficiency), sovereign, has an end in himself, is best > the end of everything

OG.content: for Rousseau, perversity of sacralizing the representer/signifier
OG.linkedContent: for Rousseau, perversity of sacralizing the representer/signifier

OG.content: sovereignty as presence/jouissance of present > liberty when signifier suspended & power rendered to the represented/signified; sovereignty not the same as drawing up laws
OG.linkedContent: sovereignty as presence/jouissance of present > liberty when signifier suspended & power rendered to the represented/signified; sovereignty not the same as drawing up laws

OG.content: acc. Rousseau, return to inalienable immediacy of self-possession (jouissance de soi), unrepresentable sovereignty—the end of written law > there is a social contract before writing, but always threatened by letter
OG.linkedContent: acc. Rousseau, return to inalienable immediacy of self-possession (jouissance de soi), unrepresentable sovereignty—the end of written law > there is a social contract before writing, but always threatened by letter

OG.content: for Rousseau, writing is origin of inequality
OG.linkedContent: for Rousseau, writing is origin of inequality

OG.content: “l’abîme, c’est le creux qui peut rester ouvert entre la défaillance de la nature et le retard du supplément” [abyss as delay, hollow, open]; pure law restores (gives back to people) liberty, gives back to presence its sovereignty [sutures abyss], pure law a supplement of supplement
OG.linkedContent: “l’abîme, c’est le creux qui peut rester ouvert entre la défaillance de la nature et le retard du supplément” [abyss as delay, hollow, open]; pure law restores (gives back to people) liberty, gives back to presence its sovereignty [sutures abyss], pure law a supplement of supplement

OG.content: Rousseau’s bonne fête > theater w/out representation, nothing to see since visibility entame la voix vivante; bonne fête: general will, sovereignty of social contract [signifier, la mort de la fête]
OG.linkedContent: Rousseau’s bonne fête > theater w/out representation, nothing to see since visibility entame la voix vivante; bonne fête: general will, sovereignty of social contract [signifier, la mort de la fête]

OG.content: no servility, effeminacy, sign, money, passivity
OG.linkedContent: no servility, effeminacy, sign, money, passivity

UWC.content: democracy dissociated from sovereignty of people (from nation-state, from citizenship) [?]
UWC.linkedContent: democracy dissociated from sovereignty of people (from nation-state, from citizenship) [?]

UWC.content: “literature,” its link to performative force of “as if,” to the right to say everything (or not to say everything), which founds both democracy & unconditional sovereignty claimed by Humanities
UWC.linkedContent: “literature,” its link to performative force of “as if,” to the right to say everything (or not to say everything), which founds both democracy & unconditional sovereignty claimed by Humanities

UWC.content: necessary to dissociate unconditional independence (of thought, deconstruction, Humanities, justice) from any phantasm of indivisible sovereignty (mastery)

UWC.content: sovereign mastery of interior > [indivisible] border of inside/outside vs. divisible limit, because divisible, it has a history > the divisible limit is the limit of the impossible, the perhaps

SPEC.content: pleasure principle cannot be contradicted (contredit); Freud confirms it in absolute sovereignty
